messageBody:
Let me make it clearer...The exception is thrown, which is what is
suppose to happen, but instead of being printed out in JUnit it
crashes JUnit. I.e. JUnit isnt automatically catching it and
flagging it as an error for the test case.

What do I need to change so that JUnit catches the exception and
reports it as an error?


--- In junit@y..., "nsparis" <nathan.paris@l...> wrote:
> In one of my tests I start a thread that will call update() when it
> is done. In the Update I check the results. If an
> assert it called because something isnt correct, I get the
Exception:
>
> junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: "Message I had in the assert
> stmt."
>
> Is there something different I need to do when I am running threads
> in my tests?
>
> Thanks
